definition:
Toeplitz Matrix
===============

A *Toeplitz matrix* is any $n\times n$ matrix with values constant along
each (top-left to lower-right) diagonal. That is, a Toeplitz matrix has
the form

$$\begin{bmatrix}
 a_0 & a_1 & a_2 & \cdots & a_{n-1} \\
 a_{-1} & a_0 & a_1 & \ddots & \vdots \\
 a_{-2} & a_{-1} & a_0 & \ddots & a_2 \\
 \vdots & \ddots & \ddots & \ddots & a_1 \\
 a_{-(n-1)} & \cdots & a_{-2} & a_{-1} & a_0
\end{bmatrix}$$

Numerical problems involving Toeplitz matrices typically have fast
solutions (only $2n-1$ distinct elements need to be solved for, as
opposed to $n^2$). For example, the inverse of a symmetric,
positive-definite $n\times n$ Toeplitz matrix can be found in
$\mathcal{O}(n^2)$ .

University Press 1993
